member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.BitBucket.Endpoints.BitBucketRepositoriesEndpoint
member.summary: Class representing the repositories endpoint in the BitBucket API.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.BitBucket.Endpoints.BitBucketRepositoriesEndpoint.GetChangesets(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of change sets associated with a repository. By default, this call returns the 15 most recent changesets. It also returns the count which is the total number of changesets on the repository. Private repositories require the caller to authenticate.
member.param: The team or individual account owning the repo.

An integer representing how many changesets to return. You can specify a limit between 0 and 50. If you specify 0 (zero), the system returns the count but returns empty values for the remaining fields.

A hash value representing the earliest node to start with. The system starts with the specified node and includes the older requests that preceded it. The Bitbucket GUI lists the nodes on the Commit tab. The default start value is the tip.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.BitBucket.Endpoints.BitBucketRepositoriesEndpoint.GetCommits(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the commit information associated with a repository. By default, this call returns all the commits across all branches, bookmarks, and tags. The newest commit is first.
member.param: The team or individual account owning the repo.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.BitBucket.Endpoints.BitBucketRepositoriesEndpoint.GetCommits(System.String,System.String,Skybrud.Social.BitBucket.Options.BitBucketCommitsOptions)
member.summary: Gets the commit information associated with a repository. By default, this call returns all the commits across all branches, bookmarks, and tags. The newest commit is first.
member.param: The team or individual account owning the repo.
The options for the call to the API.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.BitBucket.Endpoints.BitBucketRepositoriesEndpoint.GetCommit(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the information associated with an individual commit.
member.param: The team or individual account owning the repo.

A SHA value for the commit. You can also specify a branch name, a bookmark, or tag. If you do Bitbucket responds with the commit that the revision points. For example, if you supply a branch name this returns the branch tip (or head).

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.BitBucket.OAuth.BitBucketOAuthClient
member.summary: Class for handling the communication with the BitBucket API. The class has methods for handling OAuth logins using a three-legged approach as well as logic for calling the methods decribed in the BitBucket API (not all has been implemented yet).

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient
member.summary: OAuth client following the OAuth 1.0a protocol. The client will handle the necessary communication with the OAuth server (Service Provider). This includes the technical part with signatures, authorization headers and similar. The client can also be used for 3-legged logins.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.GetRequestToken
member.summary: Gets a request token from the Twitter API. After acquiring a request token, the user should be redirected to the Twitter website for approving the application. If successful, the user will be redirected back to the specified callback URL where you then can exchange the request token for an access token.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.GetAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Following the 3-legged authorization, you can exchange a request token for an access token using this method. This is the third and final step of the authorization process.
member.param: The verification key received after the user has accepted the app.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.ConsumerKey
member.summary: The consumer key of your application.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.ConsumerSecret
member.summary: The consumer secret of your application. The consumer secret is sensitiveinformation used to identify your application. Users s hould never beshown this value.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.Nonce
member.summary: A unique/random value specifying the oauth_nonce parameter in the OAuth protocol. Along with oauth_timestamp, it will make sure each request is only sent once to the OAUth server.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.Timestamp
member.summary: The current UNIX timestamp specifying the oauth_timestamp in the OAuth protocol. Along with oauth_nonce, it will make sure each request is only sent once to the OAUth server.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.Token
member.summary: The request token or access token used to access the OAuth server on behalf of a user.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.TokenSecret
member.summary: The request token secret or access token secret used to access the OAuth server on behalf of a user.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.Version
member.summary: The version of the OAuth protocol.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.Callback
member.summary: A callback URL. This property specified the oauth_callback parameter and is used for 3-legged logins. In most cases this proparty should be empty.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.RequestTokenUrl
member.summary: As the first step of the 3-legged login process, the client must obtain a request token through this URL. If possible this URL should always use HTTPS.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.AuthorizeUrl
member.summary: As the second step of the 3-legged login process, the user is redirected to this URL for authorizing the login. If possible this URL should always use HTTPS.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.AccessTokenUrl
member.summary: In the final step of the 3-legged login process, the OAuth client will exchange the request token for an access token. It will do so using this URL. If possible this URL should always use HTTPS.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.OAuth.OAuthClient.AutoReset
member.summary: If TRUE, new requests will automatically reset the oauth_timestamp and oauth_nonce with new values. I should only be disabled for testing purposes.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.Facebook.Objects.Comments.FacebookCommentsSummary
member.summary: Class representing a summary for the comments of a given object.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Facebook.Objects.Comments.FacebookCommentsSummary.Order
member.summary: Order in which comments were returned. Ranked indicates the most interesting comments are sorted first. Chronological indicates comments are sorted by the oldest comments first.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Facebook.Objects.Comments.FacebookCommentsSummary.TotalCount
member.summary:
Gets the count of comments on this node. It is important to note that this value is changed depending on the filter modifier being used (where comment replies are available):
- toplevel - this is the default, returns all top-level comments in either ranked or chronological order depending on how the comments are ordered on Facebook. This filter is useful for displaying comments in the same structure as they appear on Facebook.
- stream - all-level comments in chronological order. This filter is useful for comment moderation tools where it is helpful to see a chronological list of all comments.

member.summary: The description of the album, which will show up in news feed stories as the status message.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Facebook.Options.Albums.FacebookPostAlbumOptions.Privacy
member.summary: Privacy settings for the album. If not supplied, this defaults to the privacy level granted to the app in the Login Dialog. This field cannot be used to set a more open privacy setting than the one granted. This property only applies when creating a user album, and should therefore not be specified for page albums.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether a summary of metadata about the likes on the object should be included in the response. The summary will contain the total count of likes.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Facebook.Options.Comments.FacebookCommentsOptions.IncludeSummary
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a summary of metadata about the comments on the object should be included in the response. The summary will contain the total count of comments and how the comments are sorted (either ranked or chronological).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.Default
member.summary: Grants read-only access to public information (includes public user profile info, public repository info, and gists).

member.summary: Grants read/write access to profile info only. Note that this scope includes user:email and user:follow.

member.summary: Grants read access to a user’s email addresses.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.UserFollow
member.summary: Grants access to follow or unfollow other users.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.PublicRepo
member.summary: Grants read/write access to code, commit statuses, and deployment statuses for public repositories and organizations.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.Repo
member.summary: Grants read/write access to code, commit statuses, and deployment statuses for public and private repositories and organizations.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.RepoStatus
member.summary: Grants read/write access to public and private repository commit statuses. This scope is only necessary to grant other users or services access to private repository commit statuses without granting access to the code.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.DeleteRepo
member.summary: Grants access to delete adminable repositories.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.Notifications
member.summary: Grants read access to a user’s notifications. repo also provides this access.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.GitHub.GitHubScope.Gist
member.summary: Grants write access to gists.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric
member.summary: Class representing a metric in the Google Analytics API.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Users
member.summary: Gets the total number of users for the requested time period (type: integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Visitors
member.summary: Use Users instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.NewUsers
member.summary: Gets the number of users whose session was marked as a first-time session (type: integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.NewVisits
member.summary: Use NewUsers instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.PercentNewSessions
member.summary: Gets the percentage of sessions by people who had never visited your property before (type: percent).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.PercentNewVisits
member.summary: Use PercentNewSessions instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.SessionsPerUser
member.summary: Gets the total number of sessions divided by the total number of users (type: float).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Sessions
member.summary: Gets the total number of sessions (type = integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Visits
member.summary: Use Sessions instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Bounces
member.summary: Gets the total number of single page (or single engagement hit) sessions for your property (type: integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.SessionDuration
member.summary: Gets the total duration of user sessions represented in total seconds (type: time).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.TimeOnSite
member.summary: Use SessionDuration instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.EntranceBounceRate
member.summary: Use BounceRate instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.BounceRate
member.summary: Gets the percentage of single-page session (i.e., session in which the person left your property from the first page) (type: percent).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.VisitBounceRate
member.summary: Use BounceRate instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.AvgSessionDuration
member.summary: Gets the average duration of user sessions represented in total seconds.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.AvgTimeOnSite
member.summary: Use AvgSessionDuration instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.PageValue
member.summary: Gets the average value of this page or set of pages. Page Value is (ga:transactionRevenue + ga:goalValueAll) / ga:uniquePageviews (for the page or set of pages) (type: currency).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Entrances
member.summary: Gets the number of entrances to your property measured as the first pageview in a session. Typically used with landingPagePath (type: integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Pageviews
member.summary: Gets the total number of pageviews for your property (type: integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.UniquePageviews
member.summary: Gets the number of different (unique) pages within a session. This takes into account both the pagePath and pageTitle to determine uniqueness (type: integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.TimeOnPage
member.summary: Gets how long a user spent on a particular page in seconds. Calculated by subtracting the initial view time for a particular page from the initial view time for a subsequent page. Thus, this metric does not apply to exit pages for your property (type: time).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.Exits
member.summary: Gets the number of exits from your property (type: integer).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.EntranceRate
member.summary: Gets the percentage of pageviews in which this page was the entrance (type: percent).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.PageviewsPerSession
member.summary: Gets the average number of pages viewed during a session, including repeated views of a single page (type: float).

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.PageviewsPerVisit
member.summary: Use PageviewsPerSession instead.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Google.Analytics.Objects.AnalyticsMetric.AvgTimeOnPage
member.summary: Gets the average amount of time users spent viewing this page or a set of pages (type: time).

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.Google.GoogleService
member.summary: Class working as an entry point to the Google APIs supported by Skybrud.Social.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.Google.GoogleService.GetUserInfo
member.summary: Gets information about the authenticated user.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.Google.GoogleService.CreateFromOAuthClient(Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleOAuthClient)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance based on the specified OAuth client. The OAuth client must either have an access token or a server key. Calling this method will not make any calls to the Google Accounts API.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.Google.GoogleService.CreateFromAccessToken(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance based on an access token. Calling this method will not make any calls to the Google Accounts API.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.Google.GoogleService.CreateFromServerKey(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance based on the specified serverKey. The server key is tied to your app, whereas an access token or refresh token is tied the a specific user of your app. Calling this method will not make any calls to the Google Accounts API.
member.param: The server key of your app.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.Google.GoogleService.CreateFromRefreshToken(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance based on the specified refresh token. The refresh token is used for making a call to the Google Accounts API to get a new access token. Access tokens typically expire after an hour (3600 seconds).
member.param: The refresh token of the user.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleAccessTokenResponse.AccessToken
member.summary: The token that can be sent to a Google API.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleAccessTokenResponse.RefreshToken
member.summary: A token that may be used to obtain a new access token. Refresh tokens are valid until the user revokes access. This field is only present if access_type=offline is included in the authorization code request.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleAccessTokenResponse.ExpiresIn
member.summary: The remaining lifetime on the access token.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleAccessTokenResponse.TokenType
member.summary: The remaining lifetime on the access token.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleAccessType
member.summary: Indicates whether your application needs to access a Google API when the user is not present at the browser. This parameter defaults to online. If your application needs to refresh access tokens when the user is not present at the browser, then use offline. This will result in your application obtaining a refresh token the first time your application exchanges an authorization code for a user.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleApprovalPrompt
member.summary: Indicates whether the user should be re-prompted for consent. The default is auto, so a given user should only see the consent page for a given set of scopes the first time through the sequence. If the value is force, then the user sees a consent page even if they previously gave consent to your application for a given set of scopes.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Social.Google.OAuth.GoogleOAuthClient
member.summary: A client for handling the communication with the Google APIs using OAuth 2.0. The client is also responsible for the raw communication with the various Google APIs.

member.summary: Gets the authorization URL at accounts.google.com for your application.
member.param: Whether the application should be enabled for offline access. Default is false.

member.summary: Gets the authorization URL at accounts.google.com for your application.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.Favorites.TwitterGetFavoritesOptions.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of records to retrieve. Must be less than or equal to 200; defaults to 20. The value of count is best thought of as a limit to the number of tweets to return because suspended or deleted content is removed after the count has been applied.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.Favorites.TwitterGetFavoritesOptions.SinceId
member.summary: Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID. There are limits to the number of Tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of Tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Endpoints.Raw.TwitterGeoRawEndpoint.ReverseGeocode(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Given a latitude and a longitude, searches for up to 20 places that can be used as a place_id when updating a status. This request is an informative call and will deliver generalized results about geography.
member.param: The latitude to search around. This parameter will be ignored unless it is inside the range -90.0 to +90.0 (North is positive) inclusive. It will also be ignored if there isn't a corresponding long parameter.

The longitude to search around. The valid ranges for longitude is -180.0 to +180.0 (East is positive) inclusive. This parameter will be ignored if outside that range, if it is not a number, if geo_enabled is disabled, or if there not a corresponding lat parameter.

Provides a simple, relevance-based search interface to public user accounts on Twitter. Try querying by topical interest, full name, company name, location, or other criteria. Exact match searches are not supported.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Id
member.summary: The integer representation of the unique identifier for this User. This number is greater than 64 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. Using a signed 64 bit integer for storing this identifier is safe. Use id_str for fetching the identifier to stay on the safe side.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.IdStr
member.summary: The string representation of the unique identifier for this Tweet. Implementations should use this rather than the large integer in id. Discussion.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ScreenName
member.summary: The screen name, handle, or alias that this user identifies themselves with. screen_names are unique but subject to change. Use id_str as a user identifier whenever possible. Typically a maximum of 15 characters long, but some historical accounts may exist with longer names.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Name
member.summary: The name of the user, as they've defined it. Not necessarily a person's name. Typically capped at 20 characters, but subject to change.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Location
member.summary: Nullable. The user-defined location for this account's profile. Not necessarily a location nor parseable. This field will occasionally be fuzzily interpreted by the Search service.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Url
member.summary: Nullable. A URL provided by the user in association with their profile.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Description
member.summary: Nullable. The user-defined UTF-8 string describing their account.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.IsProtected
member.summary: When true, indicates that this user has chosen to protect their Tweets. See About Public and Protected Tweets.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.FollowersCount
member.summary: The number of followers this account currently has. Under certain conditions of duress, this field will temporarily indicate "0".

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.FriendsCount
member.summary: The number of users this account is following (AKA their "followings"). Under certain conditions of duress, this field will temporarily indicate "0".

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ListedCount
member.summary: The number of public lists that this user is a member of.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.CreatedAt
member.summary: The UTC datetime that the user account was created on Twitter.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.FavouritesCount
member.summary: The number of tweets this user has favorited in the account's lifetime. British spelling used in the field name for historical reasons.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.FavoritesCount
member.summary: The number of tweets this user has favorited in the account's lifetime.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.UtcOffset
member.summary: Nullable. The offset from GMT/UTC in seconds.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.TimeZone
member.summary: Nullable. A string describing the Time Zone this user declares themselves within.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.IsGeoEnabled
member.summary: When true, indicates that the user has enabled the possibility of geotagging their Tweets. This field must be true for the current user to attach geographic data when using POST statuses/update.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.IsVerified
member.summary: When true, indicates that the user has a verified account. See Verified Accounts.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.StatusesCount
member.summary: The number of tweets (including retweets) issued by the user.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Language
member.summary: The BCP 47 code for the user's self-declared user interface language. May or may not have anything to do with the content of their Tweets.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ContributorsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates that the user has an account with "contributor mode" enabled, allowing for Tweets issued by the user to be co-authored by another account. Rarely true.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.IsTranslator
member.summary: When true, indicates that the user is a participant in Twitter's translator community.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.FollowRequestSent
member.summary: Nullable. Perspectival. When true, indicates that the authenticating user has issued a follow request to this protected user account.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileBackgroundColor
member.summary: The hexadecimal color chosen by the user for their background.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileBackgroundImageUrl
member.summary: A HTTP-based URL pointing to the background image the user has uploaded for their profile.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileBackgroundImageUrlHttps
member.summary: A HTTPS-based URL pointing to the background image the user has uploaded for their profile.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileBackgroundTile
member.summary: When true, indicates that the user's profile_background_image_url should be tiled when displayed.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileBannerUrl
member.summary: The HTTPS-based URL pointing to the standard web representation of the user's uploaded profile banner. By adding a final path element of the URL, you can obtain different image sizes optimized for specific displays. In the future, an API method will be provided to serve these URLs so that you need not modify the original URL. For size variations, please see User Profile Images and Banners.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileImageUrl
member.summary: A HTTP-based URL pointing to the user's avatar image. See User Profile Images and Banners.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileImageUrlHttps
member.summary: A HTTPS-based URL pointing to the user's avatar image.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileLinkColor
member.summary: The hexadecimal color the user has chosen to display links with in their Twitter UI.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileSidebarBorderColor
member.summary: The hexadecimal color the user has chosen to display sidebar borders with in their Twitter UI.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileSidebarFillColor
member.summary: The hexadecimal color the user has chosen to display sidebar backgrounds with in their Twitter UI.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileTextColor
member.summary: The hexadecimal color the user has chosen to display text with in their Twitter UI.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.ProfileUseBackgroundImage
member.summary: When true, indicates the user wants their uploaded background image to be used.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.HasDefaultProfile
member.summary: Boolean When true, indicates that the user has not altered the theme or background of their user profile.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.HasDefaultProfileImage
member.summary: When true, indicates that the user has not uploaded their own avatar and a default egg avatar is used instead.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Status
member.summary: Nullable. If possible, the user's most recent tweet or retweet. In some circumstances, this data cannot be provided and this field will be omitted, null, or empty. Perspectival attributes within tweets embedded within users cannot always be relied upon. See Why are embedded objects stale or inaccurate?.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Objects.TwitterUser.Entities
member.summary: Entities which have been parsed out of the url or description fields defined by the user. Read more about Entities for Users.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the status message to reply to.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterPostStatusMessageOptions.PossiblySensitive
member.summary: If you upload tweet media that might be considered sensitive content such as nudity, violence, or medical procedures, you should set this value to true.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterPostStatusMessageOptions.Latitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the latitude of the location this tweet refers to. This parameter will be ignored unless it is inside the range -90.0 to +90.0 (North is positive) inclusive. It will also be ignored if there isn’t a corresponding longitude parameter.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterPostStatusMessageOptions.Longitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the longitude of the location this tweet refers to. The valid ranges for longitude is -180.0 to +180.0 (East is positive) inclusive. This parameter will be ignored if outside that range, if it is not a number, if geo_enabled is disabled, or if there not a corresponding latitude parameter.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterPostStatusMessageOptions.PlaceId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID for a place in the world.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterPostStatusMessageOptions.DisplayCoordinates
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to put a pin on the exact coordinates a tweet has been sent from.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the user for whom to return results for.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.ScreenName
member.summary: Gets or sets the screen name of the user for whom to return results for.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.SinceId
member.summary: Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID. There are limits to the number of Tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of Tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.Count
member.summary: Specifies the number of tweets to try and retrieve, up to a maximum of 200 per distinct request. The value of count is best thought of as a limit to the number of tweets to return because suspended or deleted content is removed after the count has been applied.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.MaxId
member.summary: Returns results with an ID less than (that is, older than) or equal to the specified ID.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.TrimUser
member.summary: When set to true, each tweet returned in a timeline will include a user object including only the status authors numerical ID. Omit this parameter to receive the complete user object.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.ExcludeReplies
member.summary: This parameter will prevent replies from appearing in the returned timeline. Using exclude_replies with the count parameter will mean you will receive up-to count tweets — this is because the count parameter retrieves that many tweets before filtering out retweets and replies.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.ContributorDetails
member.summary: This parameter enhances the contributors element of the status response to include the screen_name of the contributor. By default only the user_id of the contributor is included.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUserTimelineOptions.IncludeRetweets
member.summary:
When set to false, the timeline will strip any native retweets (though they will still count toward both the maximal length of the timeline and the slice selected by the count parameter).
Note: If you're using the trim_user parameter in conjunction with include_rts, the retweets will still contain a full user object.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterFollowersIdsOptions.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the user for whom to return results for.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterFollowersIdsOptions.ScreenName
member.summary: Gets or sets the screen name of the user for whom to return results for.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterFollowersIdsOptions.Cursor
member.summary:
Causes the results to be broken into pages. If no cursor is provided, a value of -1 will be assumed, which is the first "page".
The response from the API will include a previous_cursor and next_cursor to allow paging back and forth.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterFollowersIdsOptions.Count
member.summary: The number of users to return per page, up to a maximum of 200. Defaults to 20.

member.summary: The search query of 500 characters maximum, including operators. Queries may additionally be limited by complexity.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterSearchTweetOptions.ResultType
member.summary: Optional. Specifies what type of search results you would prefer to receive. The current default is mixed.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterSearchTweetOptions.Count
member.summary: The number of tweets to return per page, up to a maximum of 100. Defaults to 15.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterSearchTweetOptions.Until
member.summary: Returns tweets generated before the given date. Keep in mind that the search index may not go back as far as the date you specify here.

member.summary: Returns results with an ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID. There are limits to the number of tweets which can be accessed through the API. If the limit of tweets has occured since the since_id, the since_id will be forced to the oldest ID available.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterTimelineOptions.Count

member.summary: When set to true, each tweet returned in a timeline will include a user object including only the status authors numerical ID. Omit this parameter to receive the complete user object.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterTimelineOptions.ExcludeReplies
member.summary: This parameter will prevent replies from appearing in the returned timeline. Using exclude_replies with the count parameter will mean you will receive up-to count tweets — this is because the count parameter retrieves that many tweets before filtering out retweets and replies.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterTimelineOptions.ContributorDetails
member.summary: This parameter enhances the contributors element of the status response to include the screen_name of the contributor. By default only the user_id of the contributor is included.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterTimelineOptions.IncludeRetweets
member.summary:
When set to false, the timeline will strip any native retweets (though they will still count toward both the maximal length of the timeline and the slice selected by the count parameter).
Note: If you're using the trim_user parameter in conjunction with include_rts, the retweets will still contain a full user object.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterReverseGeocodeOptions.Latitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the latitude to search around. This parameter will be ignored unless it is inside the range -90.0 to +90.0 (North is positive) inclusive. It will also be ignored if there isn't a corresponding long parameter.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterReverseGeocodeOptions.Longitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the longitude to search around. The valid ranges for longitude is -180.0 to +180.0 (East is positive) inclusive. This parameter will be ignored if outside that range, if it is not a number, if geo_enabled is disabled, or if there not a corresponding lat parameter.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterReverseGeocodeOptions.Accurary
member.summary: A hint on the "region" in which to search. If a number, then this is a radius in meters, but it can also take a string that is suffixed with ft to specify feet. If this is not passed in, then it is assumed to be 0m. If coming from a device, in practice, this value is whatever accuracy the device has measuring its location (whether it be coming from a GPS, WiFi triangulation, etc.).

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterReverseGeocodeOptions.Granularity
member.summary: This is the minimal granularity of place types to return and must be one of: poi, neighborhood, city, admin or country. If no granularity is provided for the request neighborhood is assumed. Setting this to city, for example, will find places which have a type of city, admin or country.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterReverseGeocodeOptions.MaxResults
member.summary: A hint as to the number of results to return. This does not guarantee that the number of results returned will equal max_results, but instead informs how many "nearby" results to return. Ideally, only pass in the number of places you intend to display to the user here.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterStatusMessageOptions.TrimUser
member.summary: When set to true, each tweet returned in a timeline will include a user object including only the status authors numerical ID. Omit this parameter to receive the complete user object.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterStatusMessageOptions.IncludeMyRetweet
member.summary: When set to true, any Tweets returned that have been retweeted by the authenticating user will include an additional current_user_retweet node, containing the ID of the source status for the retweet.

member.name: F:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterStatusMessageOptions.IncludeEntities
member.summary: The entities node will be disincluded when set to false.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterStatusMessageOptions.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the status message to be found.

member.summary: Specifies the page of results to retrieve.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUsersSearchOptions.Count
member.summary: The number of potential user results to retrieve per page. This value has a maximum of 20.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Social.Twitter.Options.TwitterUsersSearchOptions.IncludeEntities
member.summary: The entities node will be disincluded from embedded tweet objects when set to false.
